description: From Middle English glisnen, glistnen, from Old English glisnian.

entries.meaning: A glistening shine from a wet surface.
examples: In his clear northern flesh and his fair hair was a glisten like sunshine refracted through crystals of ice.

verbs.description: glisten (third-person singular simple present glistens, present participle glistening, simple past and past participle glistened)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, of a wet or greasy surface) To reflect light with a glittering luster; to sparkle, coruscate, glint or flash.
